newsitem.title: USA: Philadelphia Suburban to levy surcharge.
newsitem.headline: Philadelphia Suburban to levy surcharge.

text.p: Philadelphia Suburban Corp said on Friday that it has been given unusual authority to tack a surcharge on to customer bills to pay for capital improvements without filing a formal rate request.
The authority was granted to the water utility by a unanimous vote of the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission.

The new surcharge will be routinely applied as a percent to customer bills to pay for capital improvements, such as repairs to pipes and hydrants, completed between formal rate requests, the company said.
The company said the surcharge will allow it to increase the time between rate requests without negatively affecting earnings.

The utility intends to file for the first surcharge this fall to go into effect on January 1, 1997. The company will be allowed to change the rate of the surcharge each quarter, with the cumulative charge not to exceed five percent.
